title: CISOs Spooked by SEC Lawsuit Against SolarWinds CISO
description:
The SEC's lawsuit against the CISO of SolarWinds is leaving CISOs across the industry spooked and reevaluating their roles.

The post CISOs Spooked by SEC Lawsuit Against SolarWinds CISO appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Cloud Security Start-Up Dig Security
description:
Palo Alto Networks has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Dig Security, a provider of Data Security Posture Management (DSPM) technology.

The post Palo Alto Networks to Acquire Cloud Security Start-Up Dig Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Atlassian CISO Urges Quick Action to Protect Confluence Instances From Critical Vulnerability
description:
Atlassian warns that a critical vulnerability in Confluence Data Center and Server could lead to significant data loss if exploited.

The post Atlassian CISO Urges Quick Action to Protect Confluence Instances From Critical Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: IAM Credentials in Public GitHub Repositories Harvested in Minutes
description:
A threat actor is reportedly harvesting IAM credentials from public GitHub repositories within five minutes of exposure.

The post IAM Credentials in Public GitHub Repositories Harvested in Minutes appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Attackers Exploiting Critical F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability
description:
Exploitation of a critical vulnerability (CVE-2023-46747) in F5’s  BIG-IP product started less than five days after public disclosure and PoC exploit code was published.

The post Attackers Exploiting Critical F5 BIG-IP Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Extending ZTNA to Protect Against Insider Threats
description:
One of the main reasons why ZTNA fails is that most ZTNA implementations tend to focus entirely on securing remote access.

The post Extending ZTNA to Protect Against Insider Threats appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: SEC Charges SolarWinds and Its CISO With Fraud and Cybersecurity Failures
description:
The SEC filed charges against SolarWinds and its CISO over misleading investors about its cybersecurity practices and known risks.

The post SEC Charges SolarWinds and Its CISO With Fraud and Cybersecurity Failures appeared first on SecurityWeek.
